result.execSummary:
The defendant Reece D Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Reece D Hanson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Reece D Hanson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Reece D Hanson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: judgment
Does not plan to seek.

Defendant Reece D Hanson in court, in custody with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:05 AM. Cirilli has Revocation Summary and no inacuracies noted. State - stipulates to 190 days jail credit, updates court on term of probation, asking for 240 days on each count (counts 2 & 3), concurrent to each other, apply good time. Cirilli makes statement and asks for time served 190 days FC jail, can pay amounts owed. Hanson makes statement. Court - 6 months in FC jail on count 2 and 6 months in FC jail on count 3 to be served concurrent with huber. Court questions jail credit and reviews, court figures 97 days jail credit. Enter civil judgement for unpaid costs, appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Reece D Hanson
Current: 4311 Jackson St, Winnebago County Jail, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States  (Effective: 04-29-2016)
Prior: P.O. Box 41, Wabeno, WI 54566 United States
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
27 days jail time or until 11/23/15 when transported by DCC, added as condition of probation without huber privileges.
Defendant is in custody at FOSO-probation hold. Copy of JOC sent to FOSO for defenant.cmg
JOC

Called at 2:19 PM. Reece Hanson appears in person and with counsel Gary Cirilli. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. State - plead to #2 and #3 as alleged, dismiss #1, joint recommendation of a withheld sentenc and plcae on probaiton for 18 months with conditions of: fine of $300 plus costs on each count, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobreity, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or liquor stores, employment/school. Cirilli responds - asks for different conditions of no consumption or possesion of alcohol and no entry into any liquor stores where the primary sale is from alcohol, not to commit any further crimes, asks for first offenders treatment if successfully completed probation. State has no objections for that. Court dismisses count #1. Hanson pleads NC to counts #2 and #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Cirlli - follow joint recommendation. Hanson withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, fine of $300 plus costs on each count - paid thru probation, 100 hours of community service within first year of probation - one count only, grants expungement under 973.015 but not automatic - must petition the court upon successfuly completion of probation, right to appeal, adjourned.
Defendant's response to state's demand for discovery
State's
Mirrors complaint
Final pre-trial on December 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Called at 3:34 PM. Reece Hanson appears in person and with counsel Gary Cirilli. State appears by Jofi Bednar Clemens. State files Information that mirrors complaint in anticipation of a waiver of PH. Cirilli and Hanson agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defenant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for trial. Cirilli has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT on 12/3/14 at 2:00 PM.
Preliminary hearing on October 22, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Reece D Hanson in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:44 pm. Has complaint waive reading, asks for PH, waive time limits. Bond continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 8, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Reece D Hanson in court without counsel.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:16 pm. State provides complaint. Court advises of charges/penalties and right to attorney. Understands charges. Wants attorney. Can hire his own. Warned not to come back without atty. Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 10:15 am.
